section.title: Fishing Guide Overview
section.p: Reference: https://ksun4176.github.io/archero2-fish-companion/
This guide explains how lake pools work, how to plan your lure spend, and how to maximize rewards with two main strategies.
Use the sections below for quick tables and step-by-step lake plans.

section.title: Rough Weight Estimates
section.p: Lake 1: 90 per lure
Lake 2: 150 per lure
Lake 3: 200 per lure
Final lake: 390 per lure

section.title: What to Buy
section.p: Always buy the lures available for silver tickets. They are worth more than they cost every time.
Buying etched runes for your main builds is the main reason to play this event. Top etched runes include Arrow of Echoes, Elemental Crit, Meteor Split, and Potion Spring.
Buying all the blessed runes is recommended. Progress toward unlocking all etched rune slots is always welcome.
Mythic artifacts are a decent option once you have the etched runes you want.
Do not buy keys unless you are playing for free. It is better to spend gems on keys directly.
It costs roughly 37 keys worth of gems to buy one S tier gear. Not recommended unless it is a personal choice.

section.title: Event Task Rewards
section.p: Login for 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 days: 5 lures per rank.
Seal Battle fight 2, 4, 6, 8, 10 times: 5 lures per rank.
Claim AFK every 3, 5, 10, 15, 20 times: 3 lures per rank.
Use gems: 200, 500, 1000, 3000, 5000 gems: 5 lures per rank.
Use keys: 10, 20, 30, 40, 50 keys: 5 lures per rank.
Use shovels: 5, 10, 15, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70, 80 shovels: 5 lures per rank.
Gold Cave fight 2, 4, 8, 10 times: 5 lures per rank.
Kill minions: 500, 1000, 1500, 2000, 3000 minions: 5 lures per rank.
Kill bosses: 5, 10, 20, 30 bosses: 3 lures per rank.
Arena: fight 5, 10, 15, 20 times: 5 lures per rank.

section.title: Rank Rewards
section.p: Your goal is to gain as much weight as possible early while keeping enough lures for later days.
Below 50kg: first place gains 100 gems.
Between 50kg-230kg: first place gains 200 gems.
Between 230kg-500kg: first place gains 300 gems.
Between 500kg-1000kg: first place gains 400 gems.
Above 1000kg: first place gains 500 gems.

section.title: Helpful Side Info
section.p: Fish per pool: 1 legendary, 3 big epics, 6 small epics, 5 large rares, 10 medium rares, 15 small rares.
On average you gain 390 silver tickets per lure in the final lake.
On average you gain 4.7 kg per lure in the final lake.
On average you gain 83 tickets per kg in the final lake.

section.title: How the Lakes Work
section.p: Fishing may seem random at first, but it is not. You can predict fish pools and plan your lures.
In the first three lakes the fish pool is the same; in the final lake the pool is doubled.
Pools contain 40 fish: 1 legendary, 9 epics, and 30 rares.
Pools reset only when you catch all fish. Snapping lines does not remove fish from the pool.
Moving to a new lake starts a fresh pool in that lake. The previous lake pool stays intact as you left it.
Final lake pool doubles to 80 fish: 2 legendaries, 18 epics, 60 rares.

section.title: Option 1: Maximize Silver Tickets
section.p: Spend many gems to maximize silver tickets.
Expect to spend 20-30k gems. Move through lakes using as few lures as possible.
Estimated gains: 110k-130k silver tickets and 16 golden tickets or more.

section.title: Option 2: Maximize Golden Tickets
section.p: Spend fewer gems to maximize golden tickets.
Expect to spend 5-15k gems. You will gain fewer silver tickets but fewer gems are required to reach 16 golden tickets.
Estimated gains: 70k-90k silver tickets and 16 golden tickets.

section.title: Lake 1: Lakehouse
section.p: You will be fishing for 2 or 3 legendary fish.
Fish a full pool of 40 first, then choose one option.

section.title: Option 1 (Higher Silver Tickets)
section.p: Start on 2x. Catch all epics and legendaries; snap lines if only rares are on the line.
Goal: catch the 2nd legendary and move to Lake 2 quickly.
If you catch the legendary early, catch the remaining fish to reach Lake 2.

section.title: Option 2 (Higher Golden Tickets)
section.p: Gather a second full pool of 40 to push into Lake 2, then go back to Lake 1.
Pull on 1x and snap all lines except for the legendary fish.
Once you have the 3rd legendary on Lake 1, move to Lake 2.
If you are over 75 snapped lines and you have not caught the legendary, switch to Option 1.

section.title: Lake 2: Sunset Coast
section.p: You will be getting 3 legendary fish.
Fish two full pools of 40. After 80 fish, switch to 2x multiplier.
Catch all epics and the legendary; snap all solely rare fish.
After catching the legendary, catch all fish until you reach Lake 3.
If you are low on line snaps (more than 50 used) after Lake 1, skip this step and catch on 10x until Lake 3.

section.title: Lake 3: Oceanic Abyss
section.p: You will be getting 3 or 4 legendary fish. Fish two full pools of 40 first, then choose one option.

section.title: Option 1 (Higher Silver Tickets)
section.p: Start on 2x multiplier, catch all epics and legendaries, and snap lines if only rares appear.
Goal: catch the 3rd legendary and move to the final lake quickly.
If you catch the legendary early, catch the remaining fish to reach the final lake.

section.title: Option 2 (Higher Golden Tickets)
section.p: Gather a third full pool of 40 to push into the final lake, then go back to Lake 3.
Pull on 1x and snap all lines except for the legendary fish.
Once you have the 4th legendary fish, move to the final lake.

section.title: Final Lake: Polar Glacier
section.p: This lake doubles the pool to 80 fish, creating a copy of every fish.

section.title: Option 1 (Higher Silver Tickets)
section.p: Minimum of 242 lures to reach 16 gold tickets.
Pull on 10x until you have spent what you want, tracking every 80 fish.
On your last pool of 80, use final line breaks to collect all epics and legendaries.

section.title: Option 2 (Higher Golden Tickets)
section.p: Minimum of 162 lures to reach 16 gold tickets.
Pull two full pools of 80, then use all line breaks left to try for the final two legendaries.
